reviews.text: I went to Barcelona recently for my birthday and stayed at Hotel Rialto. I had read other reviews which stated that the location was excellent, and this was one of the main factors in choosing the hotel. The location, I found to be outstanding, as I had been informed by other travellers. The street which the hotel is on is right near Las Ramblas and is close to other attractions and shops.
reviews.title: Wonderful City Break

reviews.text: My negative points is that they do not provide hairdryers which can be a nightmare for the ladies and an iron which i was totally suprised about as it is a 3* star hotel. The laundry service was only Monday-Friday which was no use to us. Also we experienced some noise around 8am in the morning of people banging away and talking really loudly so my advice is to get a high floor as we was on the first.

reviews.title: location location location
nothing to complain about!
reviews.text: I booked this hotel due to its superb location, once I arrived, contrary to some of the bad reviews I have read, I really liked the hotel. The rooms were clean and average size for a city hotel, and the breakfast was fine (much better than what i have experienced at some 4 and 5 star hotels in barcelona!) Everyone should stop complaining - what do they expect for the price they are paying! If you want jacuzzi baths and private butlers, stay at the Arts hotel by the beach, if you want to be in the centre and within a few minutes of all the good places, stay at the Rialto!

The Rialto is in a great location, you can walk everywhere in central Barcelona from the Hotel. The hotel is in the process of being refurbished, so there is some noise in the mornings from the building work. But all the rooms I saw have brand new doors, the rooms were clean, the room I was in had been freshly painted, it was a decent sized twin room, with a hall way and a bathroom, the towels were a bit thin, but the sheets were crisp and white. A number of people have complained that the rooms were dark, this is going to be true of many hotel rooms in cities in Spain, as many are built around very small internal courtyards, and this hotel is on a narrow street so many of the rooms are going to be dark. At €89 a night for a twin room I would recommend this hotel, it is clean and in an absolutely brilliant location. Oh and the breakfast is OK too!
reviews.title: The Riatlot is improving!
fantastic location
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location with easy access to all the main attractions of the city.The downside is the early morning noise from the streets below . Being in the centre the outlook from the rooms is very restricted and dark . Breakfasts are plentyful but the quality is not brilliant. Overall the hotel is in need of a makeover but what the heck ,in this location at this price no one can complain.

I stayed at the Rialto Hotel at the end of March with a group of friends. I didn't book the hotel myself and didn't actually ask where we were staying until the day before. When told I did a quick search on TripAdvisor and wasn't too impressed with the comments on there. As I was only staying for one night, I decided not to worry about it and concentrate on enjoying the rest of the visit. On arrival at the hotel, the staff were very nice, unlike the predictions on TripAdvisor. From then on the hotel was much better than anticipated. I had a single room which was very small, but perfectly adequate, with everything I needed. It was at the back of the hotel, so had no view and was a bit on the dark side, but at least that meant it was quiet and I wasn't going to spend much time there anyway. The room and bathroom were clean and the towels were better than your average hotel towels. The bed was comfortable, there was plenty of hot water and an extra pillow and blanket in the cupboard. Breakfast was fine if you avoided the cooked offerings and there was a good selection of food. This hotel is in a good central location. If you're looking for a budget hotel that's good value for money, this is great for a couple of nights's stay. I would use it again.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: After the reviews below I wondered what on earth to expect but The Rialto was a pleasant surprise. The rooms were clean and reasonably decorated, if a little tired looking, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was perfectly acceptable for a 3 star (4 types of cereals, yogurts, fruit the usual cheese/meats as well as the more English cooked choices). The location was excellent. It's not somewhere I'd want to stay for a holiday, but if you want a clean, basic hotel with a central location for a weekend stay, at a very reasonable price, The Rialto is hard to beat.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.text: Our room was tiny, the bathroom door wouldn't close, and there were no tea/ coffee making facilities or hairdryer in the room as is advertised. That's just for starters! When we walked into the room first we thought the curtains must be closed as the room was so dark ... this was not the case! There was a balcony leading off the room overlooking an alleyway, hence the lack of light. So anytime we were in the room, day or night, we had to have the lights on. We came back to the room one afternoon to drop off some shopping and went to turn on the light only to discover that the electricity had gone in the room!!!
